perturbation.original_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement by giving the other Party thirty (30) days' prior written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Either Party may terminate this Agreement by giving the other Party ten (10) days' prior written notice.
perturbation.explanation: California law, which governs this agreement (see section 4.10), typically requires longer notice periods for contract termination, particularly in agreements involving real estate or significant business relationships. Reducing the notice period to 10 days may be deemed unreasonable and contradict the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under California contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code § 1655-1657; Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement and all rights and licenses granted under this Agreement shall terminate as soon as practicable, but no longer than thirty (30) days, after:
3.2.1 Licensee is acquired by a third party; or
3.2.2 Licensor or any affiliate of Licensor ceases to manage Licensee.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement and all rights and licenses granted under this Agreement shall terminate immediately after:
3.2.1 Licensee is acquired by a third party; or
3.2.2 Licensor or any affiliate of Licensor ceases to manage Licensee.
perturbation.explanation: California law favors providing reasonable timeframes for winding down contractual obligations to avoid undue hardship. Immediately terminating the agreement upon acquisition or change in management, without any transition period, could be considered commercially unreasonable and potentially violate the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under California law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code § 1655-1657; Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing

perturbation.original_text: Upon termination of this Agreement, Licensed Users shall immediately cease use of the Licensed Trade Name and Licensed Mark as soon as practicable, but no longer than thirty (30) days, after termination.
perturbation.changed_text: Upon termination of this Agreement, Licensed Users shall immediately cease use of the Licensed Trade Name and Licensed Mark immediately after termination.
perturbation.explanation: While immediate cessation might seem reasonable, trademark law often allows for a brief, reasonable period to exhaust existing marketing materials or transition branding. Forcing immediate cessation, especially for a real estate investment trust that needs time to rebrand or transition marketing collateral, could be argued as commercially unreasonable and violate the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under California contract law, particularly given the potential financial impact.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code § 1655-1657; Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
